p.s: Description of Roseibacillus persicicus sp. nov.

Roseibacillus persicicus (per.si′ci.cus. L. n. persicum a peach; L. suff. -icus -a -um suffix used with the sense of belonging to; N.L. masc. adj. persicicus belonging to peach, because the bacterium is peach-coloured).
Main characteristics are the same as those given for the genus.
In addition, cells are 0.7–0.8 μm wide and 1.0–1.5 μm long.
Neither cellular gliding movement nor swarming growth is observed.
Colonies grown on 1/5-strength MA are circular, convex and pink in colour.
The temperature range for growth is 15–37 °C, with optimal growth at 30–37 °C.
No growth occurs at either 4 or 45 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–9.0.
NaCl is required for growth and can be tolerated up to 7 % (w/v).

Alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase tests are positive, but esterase lipase (C8), esterase (C4), N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, valine arylamidase, lipase (C4), cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase tests are negative.

Dextrin, glycogen, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, trehalose, furanose, xylitol, succinic acid, l-glutamic acid, dl-carnitine, urocanic acid, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, glucose 1-phosphate and glucose 6-phosphate are oxidized.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contained muramic acid and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 58.3 mol%.
The type strain is YM26-010T (=MBIC08317T =KCTC 12988T), which was isolated from iron sand.
